programmes.show_description: In the 80s the Scottish scene was vibrant and creative with punk, indie, synth, acoustic and Celtic folk influences topping the charts. Altered Images' Clare Grogan has 30 of the best.
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1980!
10 artists that had a single big song in 1980 - then never darkened the UK Top 20 ever again! Remember The Vapors or Styx?
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1980!
Sixty minutes of back-to-back number 1s from 1980 - from Pink Floyd to Blondie, via Dexys, ABBA and Kelly Marie. With Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1980!
Sixty minutes of lesser heard hits from 1980. Including AC/DC, Stray Cats, Jermaine Jackson, Gary Numan, Donna Summer and Gilbert O'Sullivan.
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1980!
Hits and headlines from the year of Barbara Woodhouse, Button Moon and Metal Mickey, and when Steven Gerrard was born as Liverpool were crowned league champions!
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1980!

programmes.show_name: Most Weeks in UK Chart? Top 100
programmes.show_description: Who spent the most weeks in the UK top 75 during the whole decade? We countdown the top 100 artists with longevity - all their song weeks combined, and surprises are a guarantee!
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Kim Wilde, Cliff Richard, OMD, Duran Duran & Heaven 17.
Dancefloor action with 20 extended mixes and king-size videos of '80s classics. From Aztec Camera and A-Ha to Queen, Visage and Whitney Houston. Mark Goodier is on the ones and twos!
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Tears Fears, Freddie Mercury & Level 42.
Bruno Brookes flicks through the pages of another Yearbook. 1985 introduced us to A-ha and Whitney Houston, and also saw the world's biggest ever concert - Live Aid!
NOW 5 had many hits but also featured some lesser known songs. From David Bowie to Duran Duran, Steve Arrington to Jimmy Nail - every video we could find is here!
NOW 5 had many hits but also featured some lesser known songs. From David Bowie to Duran Duran, Steve Arrington to Jimmy Nail - every video we could find is here!
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights and iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1985!
NOW 7 was released in 1986 and featured all the tracks of the moment. A double vinyl or double tape, the choice was yours - but the double CD had to wait until NOW 10!
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights and iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1986!
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights and iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made the 80s!

programmes.show_name: The Heritage Chart with Mike Read
programmes.show_description: Another episode of the Heritage Chart - new music by heritage acts! With Mike Read.

programmes.show_name: Wake Me Up Before You Go Go!
programmes.show_description: Your '80s party channel - 24/7. Expect synth pop, soft rock, leg warmers, lycra and lots of big hair! Classic pop that has stood the test of time.
1981 was another top year in music, with the New Romantics and Synth Pop conquering the world and changing the sound of the chart forever. Bruno Brookes has the story - month by month.
With British artists achieving unprecedented success across the world, Bruno Brookes has a stellar selection of songs charting the 1st year of "NOW That's What I Call Music" - 1983.
Bruno Brookes flicks through the pages of another Yearbook. 1985 introduced us to A-ha and Whitney Houston, and also saw the world's biggest ever concert - Live Aid!
Jenny Powell flicks through the pages of another Yearbook. 1987 had 'No Limits' on the TV & Stock, Aitken & Waterman cranking an endless stream of massive, catchy hits!
Jenny Powell flicks through the pages of another Yearbook. 1989 saw the breakthrough of Italian house, the rise of Mad-chester and Stock, Aitken and Waterman in their imperial phase!
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights and iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1989!

programmes.show_name: Who Had The Most Hits in the 80s?
programmes.show_description: Counting down the 40 acts with more Top 10 hits to their names than any other stars of the decade. U2, Shaky, Queen, Wham! and Prince are all here, but who's No.1?
